headline.main: National Briefing | Mid-Atlantic: Maryland: Plans For Emergency Bunker

lead_paragraph: Baltimore is converting a cold-war-era fallout shelter into an emergency operations center that can be used in a terrorist attack. Renovation of the shelter, beneath a fire station in the northern part of the city, will cost about $400,000, the city's emergency management agency said. The shelter, with 22-inch-thick walls designed to withstand a nuclear attack, can hold about 50 people. It could be used by the mayor, the police and fire chiefs and other top city officials, as well as the Red Cross, the National Guard and the Baltimore Gas and Electric Company. Gary Gately (NYT)
